btw 0.0.0.9001

Tools: Register tools from btw

Source: R/register.R
btw_register_tools.Rd

The btw_register_tools() function equips an ellmer chat to interface with your computational environment. Chats returned by this function have access to the tools:

NameGroupDescription
btw_tool_describe_data_framedataShow the data frame or table or get information about the structure of a data frame or table.
btw_tool_get_available_vignettes_in_packagedocsList available vignettes for an R package.
btw_tool_get_help_pagedocsGet help page from package.
btw_tool_get_installed_packagesdocsDisplays the name and title of all installed R packages in json format.
btw_tool_get_package_help_topicsdocsGet available help topics for an R package.
btw_tool_get_vignette_from_packagedocsGet a package vignette in plain text.
btw_tool_describe_environmentenvironmentList and describe items in an environment.
btw_tool_list_filesfilesList files in the current working directory or in subfolders in the current project directory.
btw_tool_read_text_filefilesRead an entire text file.
btw_tool_read_current_editorideRead the contents of the editor that is currently open in the user's IDE.

Usage

btw_register_tools(chat, include = NULL)

Arguments

chat

An ellmer Chat object.

include

Names of tools or tool groups to include when registering tools, e.g. include = "docs" to include only the documentation related tools, or include = c("data", "docs", "environment"), etc.

Value

Registers the tools with chat, updating the chat object in place. The chat input is returned invisibly.

See also

Other Tools: btw_tool_describe_data_frame(), btw_tool_describe_environment(), btw_tool_get_installed_packages(), btw_tool_list_files(), btw_tool_package_docs, btw_tool_read_current_editor(), btw_tool_read_text_file()

Examples

# requires an ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
ch <- ellmer::chat_claude()

btw_register_tools(ch)
} # }
